snippet: Googleâ€™s new plan to partner with retailers and start a delivery service is an example of how big tech companies are branching out and blurring the lines between their businesses.
abstract: Google is working on a delivery service that would let people order items from local stores on the Web and receive them at their homes or offices within a day; new venture is part of broader effort by Google to move beyond its search service into commerce.

headline.main: A New Google Venture, and Another Web Boundary Line Is Nudged
headline.print_headline: A New Google Venture, and Another Web Boundary Line Is Nudged

snippet: When they made Tory Burch - gorgeous, successful, smart, loving - they forgot the flaws. Damn it.

snippet: A viral Internet video has raised privacy concerns about an obscure piece of data-collection software that is embedded in millions of cellphones. Trevor Eckhart, a 25-year-old programmer, shows that a program called Carrier IQ may be quietly loggi...
abstract: A viral Internet video has raised privacy concerns about an obscure piece of data-collection software that is embedded in millions of cellphones. Trevor Eckhart, a 25-year-old programmer, shows that a program called Carrier IQ may be quietly logging much of a phone user's activity.

headline.main: Programmer Raises Concerns About Phone-Monitoring Software

snippet: Many tech industry giants will scramble to sustain relevance because of the convergence of mobile devices, social networking, and cloud-based computing and data storage, IDC predicts in a new study. If the IDC's view ends up being correct, the tec...
abstract: Many tech industry giants will scramble to sustain relevance because of the convergence of mobile devices, social networking, and cloud-based computing and data storage, IDC predicts in a new study. If the IDC's view ends up being correct, the technology industry is in the midst of perhaps its fastest-ever transition.

headline.main: Cloud Computing as a Threat to Older Tech Companies
